newsitem.title: QATAR: Qatar stocks marginally up on high trade volume.
newsitem.headline: Qatar stocks marginally up on high trade volume.

text.p: Trade on Qatar's official bourse surged 32 percent to 11,603 shares in the week to Thursday, but the index edged up only marginally, dealers said.
The Commercial Bank of Qatar (CBQ) 17-share index closed less than half a point up at 148.74 against 148.31 points in the week before.
A statement by the official Doha Securities Market said the value of shares traded increased 10 percent to 1.4 million riyals ($385,000) from 1.27 million.

Banks accounted for 56 percent of the trade with 2,859 shares valued at 783,989 riyals and industrials came next at 31 percent with 6,010 shares worth 441,520 riyals. Services followed at 13 percent with 2,734 shares worth 174,535 riyals.
Seven stocks ended higher, two declined and eight remained unchanged.
Market leader Qatar National Bank added three riyals to 654, and Al Ahli Bank of Qatar rose one riyal to 320. The CBQ shed five riyals to 365 and Qatar Islamic Bank lost 10 riyals to 165.
Qatar Cinema gained five riyals to 230, Qatar Real Estate gained 1.75 riyals to 61.75 and Qatar Shipping rose one riyal to 48.
Qatar Flour Mills jumped under heavy demand 34 riyals to 374 and Qatar Industrial Manufacturing Co. added two riyals to 70.
